title: How to Upgrade Your PSP Firmware

steps.title: Connect your PSP to a wireless network.
steps.content: Connect your PSP to a wireless network. Your PSP will need to be connected to the network in order to download the update files. If you don't have a wireless internet connection, you can update your PSP using your computer.

steps.title: Open the Settings menu.
steps.content: Open the Settings menu. This is located on the far-left end of the XMB.

steps.title: Select "System Update".
steps.content: Select "System Update". This can be found at the top of the Settings menu.

steps.title: Select "Update via Internet".
steps.content: Select "Update via Internet".

steps.title: Select your network connection.
steps.content: Select your network connection. If you don't have any networks to select, you will need to setup a connection first .

steps.title: Download any available updates.
steps.content: Download any available updates. The PSP will search for updates. If one is found, you can press "X" to start downloading it.

steps.title: Start the update.
steps.content: Start the update. After the update has been downloaded, you will be prompted to start installing it. Press "X" to start the update process. If you need to go back and install the update later, navigate to Settings, select "System Update", and then select "Update via Storage Media".

steps.title: Create a new folder on your desktop.
steps.content: Create a new folder on your desktop. Name it PSP . It must be all upper-case.

steps.title: Open the PSP folder and create a GAME folder.
steps.content: Open the PSP folder and create a GAME folder. Again, it must be all upper-case.

steps.title: Open the GAME folder and create an UPDATE folder.
steps.content: Open the GAME folder and create an UPDATE folder. This one must be upper-case as well.

steps.title: Download the latest firmware from the PlayStation website.
steps.content: Download the latest firmware from the PlayStation website. You can download the PSP firmware from the system updates page . The file you download should be called EBOOT.PBP . The latest and final firmware version is 6.61

steps.title: Move the downloaded file into the UPDATE folder.
steps.content: Move the downloaded file into the UPDATE folder.

steps.title: Connect your PSP to your computer via USB, or insert your Memory Stick Duo card into your computer's card reader.
steps.content: Connect your PSP to your computer via USB, or insert your Memory Stick Duo card into your computer's card reader. If you connect your PSP to your computer, navigate to the Settings menu and select "USB Connection".

steps.title: Open the Memory Stick Duo folder.
steps.content: Open the Memory Stick Duo folder. When you connect your PSP or insert your memory card, you should be asked if you want to open the folder. If not, open your Computer window and select the "Ms Duo" option.

steps.title: Copy the PSP folder you created onto the memory card.
steps.content: Copy the PSP folder you created onto the memory card. You may already have a PSP folder, which you can overwrite. This will add the update data to your PSP.

steps.title: Disconnect your PSP or memory card from your computer.
steps.content: Disconnect your PSP or memory card from your computer.

steps.title: Navigate to the Game menu on the XMB.
steps.content: Navigate to the Game menu on the XMB.

steps.title: Select the "Memory Stick" option.
steps.content: Select the "Memory Stick" option.

steps.title: Select your update file.
steps.content: Select your update file. The PSP will begin the installation process.

steps.title: Insert a UMD containing the update.
steps.content: Insert a UMD containing the update. Some games contain firmware updates on the disc. The last firmware included on a UMD was 6.37.

steps.title: Navigate to the Game menu.
steps.content: Navigate to the Game menu.

steps.title: Select "PSP Update ver.
steps.content: Select "PSP Update ver . X.XX ". The X s will be replaced by the version number of the update. The update will have a UMD icon, and is typically below the actual game in the Game menu.

steps.title: Follow the prompts to install the update.
steps.content: Follow the prompts to install the update.

steps.title: Ensure your system is updated to version 6.60.
steps.content: Ensure your system is updated to version 6 .60. Follow one of the methods above to do so. This is required to install the custom firmware.

steps.title: Download the "Pro CFW" files.
steps.content: Download the "Pro CFW" files. These are the custom firmware files that allow you to use homebrew programs on your PSP. They can be found at a variety of places online. Make sure to download the latest version that is compatible with 6.60.

steps.title: Extract the "Pro CFW" archive.
steps.content: Extract the "Pro CFW" archive. This will extract into the familiar PSP/GAME folder structure. The GAME folder will contain the custom firmware files.

steps.title: Connect your PSP to your computer via USB, or insert your Memory Stick Duo card into your computer's card reader.
steps.content: Connect your PSP to your computer via USB, or insert your Memory Stick Duo card into your computer's card reader. If you connect your PSP to your computer, navigate to the Settings menu and select "USB Connection".

steps.title: Open the Memory Stick Duo folder.
steps.content: Open the Memory Stick Duo folder. When you connect your PSP or insert your memory card, you should be asked if you want to open the folder. If not, open your Computer window and select the "Ms Duo" option.

steps.title: Copy the extracted PSP/GAME folder onto the memory card.
steps.content: Copy the extracted PSP/GAME folder onto the memory card.

steps.title: Disconnect your PSP or memory card.
steps.content: Disconnect your PSP or memory card. Insert the memory card back in the PSP if necessary.

steps.title: Navigate to the Game menu and run the "Pro Update" application.
steps.content: Navigate to the Game menu and run the "Pro Update" application. Follow the prompts to install the custom firmware.

steps.title: Run "Fast Recovery" whenever you reboot your system.
steps.content: Run "Fast Recovery" whenever you reboot your system. This can be found in the Game menu, and is required to reactive the custom firmware when the PSP restarts. [1] X Research source
